element.name: Resuscitation Attempted By EMS
element.definition: Indication of an attempt to resuscitate the patient who is in cardiac arrest (attempted, not attempted due to DNR, etc.)
element.v3Comment: This element is a component of the Utstein Cardiac Arrest Criteria as identified in the American Heart Association journal "Resuscitation" from 2004 entitled "Cardiac Arrest and Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation Outcome Reports". http://circ.ahajournals.org/cgi/content/full/110/21/3385

asserts.assert: Resuscitation Attempted By EMS should be recorded when Cardiac Arrest is "Yes...".
Resuscitation Attempted By EMS should only be recorded when Cardiac Arrest is "Yes...".
Resuscitation Attempted By EMS should not contain both "Attempted/Initiated..." and "Not Attempted...".
Resuscitation Attempted By EMS should contain "Initiated Chest Compressions" when Type of CPR Provided contains "Compressions...".
Resuscitation Attempted By EMS should contain "Attempted Ventilation" when Type of CPR Provided contains "Ventilation..." or "Compressions-Intermittent with Ventilation".
Type of CPR Provided should contain "Compressions..." when Resuscitation Attempted By EMS contains "Initiated Chest Compressions".
Type of CPR Provided should contain "Ventilation..." or "Compressions-Intermittent with Ventilation" when Resuscitation Attempted By EMS contains "Attempted Ventilation".
When Resuscitation Attempted By EMS has a Not Value (Not Applicable, Not Recorded, or Not Reporting), it should be empty.

When Resuscitation Attempted By EMS is empty, it should have a Not Value (Not Applicable, Not Recorded, or Not Reporting, if allowed for the element) or a Pertinent Negative (if allowed for the element), or it should be omitted (if the element is optional).
When Resuscitation Attempted By EMS has a Not Value, no other value should be recorded.
